Resources

Here’s a list of the books and other resources we have used to work on our relationship. I’m breaking it up according to category so you’ll know exactly what you’ll be getting with each one. I hope it is helpful!

The Differences Between Men and Women- Understand the Opposite Sex  

  1. Men are from Mars, Women are from Venus, by John Gray- This is the core of the Mars/Venus series, it offers a unique perspective on the differences between men and women. By using an analogy that men and women are two entirely different species from different planets, the author explains the different needs, wants and characteristics of both sexes.  It has been called the Bible for good relationships. 
  2. Mars and Venus in the Bedroom, by John Gray- This book goes into detail on the differences between men and women in regards to their sexuality. Men and women are fundamentally different, and this is expressed in their sexual interests too. By reading the book you will come to understand what your partner thinks, feels and wants in sex (and there’s a lot more going on than just physical pleasure). It is full of helpful insights as well as practical tips to enhance both partner’s sexual experience. 
  3. Understanding Women, Unlock the Mystery (Live workshop or DVD/CD), by Alison Armstrong- This workshop is devoted to removing the mystery on members of the opposite sex. By becoming familiar with the reflexes and instincts unique to men and women, (the same reflexes that have protected the Hunter/Gatherer for thousands of years), we come to understand the fundamental differences between the sexes that are still at work today. The workshop is fun, funny, and designed to add love back into your relationship. For a full review, click here.   
  4. Keys to the Kingdom, by Alison Armstrong- Written as a novel, Keys to the Kingdom explains men in a way we can understand. Claudia, one of the main characters, shares her treasure trove of wisdom on men and relationships. She teaches us how to stop being “frog farmers” (those women who turn even the most princely men into ugly toads), and how to bring out the best in our men instead. For a full review, click here.

Understanding Romantic Love- How Marriage is Different from All Other Relationships 

  1. Getting the Love You Want, by Harville Hendrix- In this book you will learn all about the psychology and chemistry of romantic love, what caused us to “fall in love” and why even great marriages seem to struggle once the “romantic stage” wears away. Most importantly, Hendrix teaches us how to turn the frustrations and pain of an intimate relationship into a catalyst for growth and lasting love. For a full review, click here.   

Positive Communication- Basic Skills for Any Relationship 

  1. How to Talk So Kids Will Listen and Listen So Kids Will Talk, by Adele Faber and Elaine Mazlish- Although this book is targeted specifically towards parents dealing with young children, in reality it is an incredible guidebook for good communication in any relationship. There are not many books out there that teach us how to communicate effectively, in a way that respects our peers and improves the quality of our relationships. This book does will become your guide for all those things and more.
  2. How to Win Friends and Influence People, by Dale Carnegie- first printed in 1937, this classic offers timeless insights into people and relationships. It is literally a how-to guide in effectively dealing with people. The chapter titles speak for themselves: chapter 1 is titled “Fundamental Techniques in Handling People”, chapter 2 is “Six Ways to Make People Like You” etc.



There are obviously many more great books out there, these are just the ones we have read and benefited from. I’ll be sure to add more reviews over time.
